title: Colleen Hewett sells her suburban Bendigo mud-brick home for $350,000
text:
Seventies pop star Colleen Hewett has sold her childhood mud-brick home in suburban Bendigo for $350,000, reports Realestate.com.au.

The 69-year-old singer, who is known for her hits Day by Day and Carry That Weight, had helped build the two-bedroom property with her parents four decades ago.

'We all slopped around in the mud and helped them achieve their dream house. Now it's my dream house, but it's time to let go,' she said.

End of an era: Seventies pop star Colleen Hewett has sold her childhood mud-brick home in suburban Bendigo for $350,000. Pictured on February 13, 2006 in Sydney

'It's a happy occasion in one way but in another way it's a bit sad to be letting [her parents'] dream go, but I just want some people in here to love it and live in it,' Colleen added.

'It's a house made of love and it should be, and has been, loved - so I want the love to continue.'

Colleen, who was born in Bendigo, has relocated to Melbourne since selling the Junortoun home earlier this month.

Labour of love: The 69-year-old singer, who is known for her hits Day by Day and Carry That Weight, had helped build the two-bedroom property with her parents four decades ago

Fond memories: 'We all slopped around in the mud and helped them achieve their dream house. Now it's my dream house, but it's time to let go,' she said. Pictured: the kitchen

The songstress rose to fame in Australia in the early 1970s and, during her heyday, would regularly top the Top 40 Kent Music Report charts.

Her cover of Day by Day peaked at No. 1, and is certified as a gold record.

Colleen was voted 'Queen of Pop' twice, in 1972 and 1973, in TV Week magazine's annual King of Pop Awards.

Icon: Colleen rose to fame in Australia in the early 1970s and, during her heyday, would regularly top the Top 40 Kent Music Report charts. Pictured: the living room

After appearing in several TV musicals, Colleen turned to acting in 1985 and played Sheila Brady in the cult television series, Prisoner.

Her musical theatre credits include: Chicago, The Boy from Oz (alongside Hugh Jackman) and Shout! The Legend of The Wild One.

She has been in semi-retirement since the year 2000, dividing her time between Melbourne, Bendigo and Fiji.
description: Seventies pop star Colleen Hewett has sold her childhood mud-brick home in suburban Bendigo for $350,000, reports Realestate.com.au.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
